title: Transcript invalid blocks in blockchain tests
body:
evmone does not support rlp. Maybe some others too.

The current blockchain tests that have invalid blocks describe invalid block as rlp field only. And valid block as rlp and its json decoding into transactions, blockheader, etc.

Since long time tests now have expected exceptions, and all invalid rlp tests are moved to rlp tests.
So the invalid blocks must be valid rlps just expected to be rejected.

Proposal is to parse block from test as invalid if it has expected exception other then that invalid block will have all the same fields in tests as a valid one.

Affected: custom test runner tools
Backwards compatibility: legacy tests will break.

Question to the teams is this easy to implement in tools, is it ok? Some code might be hardcoded to expect rlp section only. 

Alternatively can have invalid blocks transcripted but in a different way than valid. Putting the json transcription into sub json section for instance.
